intro: Anthospermum dregei subsp. ecklonis, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface, and it often grows in rocky or sandy soils. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, making it a striking addition to gardens and natural landscapes.
